alert.note: Alert for Hockley; Lubbock; Lynn; Terry (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 9:48PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorm outflow winds will impact portions of southwestern Lubbock, central Lynn, northeastern Terry and southeastern Hockley Counties through 1015 PM CDT... At 946 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking outflow winds from a collapsing thunderstorm 9 miles west of Slide, or 17 miles southwest of Lubbock, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar and West Texas Mesonet indicated. A mesonet station near Brownfield recorded a wind gust to 60 mph at 928 PM. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Tahoka, Wolfforth, Slide, Meadow, Wilson, Ropesville and New Home. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Not all areas will receive additional rainfall, but strong wind gusts can be expected as this storm collapses. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
